import React from 'react'; import ProblemPage from '../ProblemPage/ProblemPage'; const Problem3 = ({ handleProblemCompletion, isSolved, savedAnswer, themeColors }) => { return (

Here are some hints to help you solve this puzzle:

Each term refers to one of the 12 Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG).
Each guideline has a number in the format (x.x). Both numbers are important.
Use the first number to select one of the four main accessibility principles.
Use the second number to index the letter from that principle's name. Combine the letters from all the guidelines to find the answer.
Each guideline has a number in the format (x.y).

Use the first number to select one of the four main accessibility principles:
1 = Perceivable, 2 = Operable, 3 = Understandable, 4 = Robust.

Then, use the second number to pick a letter from that principle's name (e.g., 1 = first letter, 2 = second letter, and so on). Combine the letters from all the guidelines to find the answer."

provide text alternative ‚Üí (1.1) ‚Üí Perceivable
compatibility ‚Üí (4.1) ‚Üí Robust
keyboard accessible ‚Üí (2.1) ‚Üí Operable
input assistance ‚Üí (3.3) ‚Üí Understandable
readable ‚Üí (3.1) ‚Üí Understandable
distinguishable ‚Üí (1.4) ‚Üí Perceivable
seizures ‚Üí (2.3) ‚Üí Operable

Answer: PRODUCE
} >

provide text alternative

compatibility

keyboard accessible

input assistance

readable

distinguishable

seizures

 ); }; export default Problem3;
